info.title: Gigs Core API
info.description: API to manage voice & data plans for smartphones, wearables and IoT in 200+ countries.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the device model.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing device model.

200.description: Returns the device model object if it exists.

post.description: Searches for existing devices models matching the given parameters.

requestBody.description: Device model attributes to search for.

imei.description: The IMEI (international mobile equipment identity) of the corresponding device.

200.description: Returns a list schema response with all found device models.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

get.description: Returns a list of device models. The models returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created models appearing first.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of types to be filtered by.

parameters.name: brand
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of brands to be filtered by.

parameters.name: simType
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of SIM types to be filtered by.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of device models.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the device.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing device owned by the authenticated user.

200.description: Returns the device object if it exists.

delete.description: Retrieves the details of an existing device and deletes it.

200.description: Returns the device after a successful deletion.

patch.description:
Updates the given properties of an existing device.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

requestBody.description: The device properties to update, at least one of them must be provided. Use null or an empty array to remove existing values.

name.description: An optional custom name for the device.

sims.description: List of identifiers for all SIMs currently attached to the device.

user.description: Unique user identifier for the device owner.

200.description: Returns the updated device object.

post.description: Searches for existing devices matching the given parameters. The search will only return factory devices not yet assigned to any user, or devices already owned by the current user.

imei.description: The IMEI (international mobile equipment identity) of the device.

200.description: Returns a list schema response with all found devices.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

get.description: Returns a list of devices. The devices returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created devices appearing first.

parameters.name: sim
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the sim to be filtered by.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user to be filtered by.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of devices.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

post.description: Creates a new device with the given parameters.

requestBody.description: Device attributes to create. You must specify either an IMEI or a user.

imei.description: The IMEI (international mobile equipment identity) of the device.

user.description: Unique user identifier for the device owner.

sims.description: List of identifiers for all SIMs to attach to the device.

name.description: An optional custom name for the device.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan.

post.description:
Set the status of a plan to archived. An archived plan can not be used to create new subscriptions.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

200.description: Returns the archived plan.

value.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
value.name: Gigs Global

parameters.name: plan
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the document.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing document for a given plan.

200.description: Returns the plan if it exists and is owned by the plan.

parameters.name: plan
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan.

get.description: Returns a list of documents related to the given plan. The documents returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created documents appearing first.

200.description: Returns a list of document objects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan.

get.description: Retrieve the details of an existing plan.

200.description: Returns the plan if it exists.

value.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
value.name: Gigs Global

patch.description: Updates the specified plan by setting the values of the parameters passed.

name.description: The plan's name, meant to be displayable to the users.

description.description: The plan's description, meant to be displayable to the users.
examples: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.

image.description: The plan's image, meant to be displayable to the users.

value.name: Gigs Global

value.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan.

post.description:
Set the status of a plan to available. Available plans can be used to create new subscriptions.

> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email

200.description: Returns the available plan.

value.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
value.name: Gigs Global

get.description: Returns a list of plans.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The network provider ID to filter the plans by.

parameters.name: simType
parameters.description: The type of SIM card to filter the plans by.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: The status to filter the plans by. Only available plans are returned by default.

200.description: Returns a list of plan objects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

items.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
items.name: Gigs Global

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the porting.

post.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing porting and cancels it. Only portings that have not yet being completed can be canceled.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

200.description: Returns the canceled porting.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the porting.

get.description:
Retrieves the details of an existing porting.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

200.description: Returns the porting.

patch.description:
Updates the specified porting by setting the values of the parameters passed.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

accountNumber.description: The account number on the donor service provider.

accountPin.description: The pin for the account on the donor service provider. This will be used only for the porting.

birthday.description: The birthday of the account holder on the donor service provider.

donorProvider.description: The unique identifier of the donor service provider.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number to port in E.164 format. This is only updatable when the porting is in a status of: draft

provider.description: The ID of the recipient network provider. This is only updatable when the porting is in a status of: draft

200.description: Returns the updated porting.

get.description:
Returns a list of portings. The portings returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created portings appearing first.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of portings.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

post.description:
Creates a new porting with the parameters passed. The porting will be created in `draft` status and can be later used to create an order or subscription for the given network provider.

Only some of the fields are required during creation creation, but all of the ones required by the network provider must be set before submitting the porting.


<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This endpoint is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

accountNumber.description: The account number on the donor service provider.

accountPin.description: The pin for the account on the donor service provider. This will be used only for the porting.

birthday.description: The birthday of the account holder on the donor service provider.

donorProvider.description: The unique identifier of the donor service provider.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number to port in E.164 format.

provider.description: The name of the receiving network provider.

user.description: The unique identifier for an existing [user](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/b3A6MzMwODcxNDM-retrieve-a-user) the porting should be created for.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing project accessible by the API client.

200.description: Returns the project object if it exists.

get.description:
Retrieve the credentials of an existing project.

200.description: Returns the project credentials.

paymentsKey.description: Publishable API key for payment integration.

get.description: Returns a list of projects. The projects returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created projects appearing first.

parameters.name: organization
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the organization to be filtered by.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of projects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: recipientProvider
parameters.description: Only return service providers that have the given network provider as supported porting recipient.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of service providers.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the SIM.

get.description: Retrieve the credentials of an existing SIM.

200.description: Returns the SIM credentials.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the SIM.

get.description: Retrieve the details of an existing SIM which the authenticated user is authorized to view.

200.description: Returns the SIM if it exists.

post.description: Searches for existing SIMs matching the given parameters.

iccid.description: The ICCID (integrated circuit card identifier) associated with the SIM.

type.description: Optional type of the SIM card, either `eSIM`, `pSIM` or both.

200.description: Returns a list schema response with all found SIMs.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

get.description: Returns a list of SIMs. The SIMs returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created SIMs appearing first.

parameters.name: provider
parameters.description: The network provider ID for the sim to be filtered by.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of statuses to filter the sims by.

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: The type for the sim to be filtered by.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user to be filtered by.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of SIMs.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

post.description: Retrieves the details of an existing subscription and schedules termination of the plan at the end of the next renewal date. You need only supply the unique subscription identifier that was returned upon purchasing a plan.

200.description: Returns the subscription after a successful cancellation.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing subscription. You need only supply the unique subscription identifier that was returned upon purchasing a plan.

200.description: Returns the subscription if it exists.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

delete.description: Ends an active plan subscription immediately. You only need to supply the unique subscription identifier that was returned upon purchasing a plan.

200.description: Returns the ended subscription after a successful termination.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

post.description: Removes the cancellation and end times of the subscription. The subscription will continue to auto-renew until canceled again.

200.description: Returns the resumed subscription.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

get.description: Returns a list of subscriptions. The subscriptions returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created subscriptions appearing first.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user to be filtered by.

parameters.name: plan
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the plan to be filtered by.

parameters.name: sim
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the sim to be filtered by.

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: A comma-separated list of statuses to filter the subscriptions by. Only pending and active subscriptions are returned by default.

200.description: Returns a list of subscription objects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

post.description: Creates a new subscription for an existing user in the specified project.

requestBody.description: Optional and required parameters to be passed in the request body to create a new subscription:

plan.description: The unique identifier for the existing [plan](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/b3A6MzMwODcxMzA-retrieve-a-plan) to be used for the subscription.

sim.description: The unique identifier for the existing [SIM](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/b3A6MzMwODcxMzQ-retrieve-a-sim) to be used for the subscription. In combination with an eSIM plan, it can be omitted to request a new eSIM.

userAddress.description: The unique identifier for the existing [user address](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/b3A6MzMwODcxNDk-retrieve-a-user-address) to be used for the subscription. Only needed if the plan requires an address.

user.description: The unique identifier for the existing [user](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/b3A6MzMwODcxNDM-retrieve-a-user) to which the subscription will be assigned.

porting.description:
The unique identifier for the existing draft [porting](https://developers.gigs.com/docs/api/bea041f643438-retrieve-a-porting) to be used for the subscription.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This property is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

201.description: Returns the newly created subscription and supporting objects.

plan.description: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.
plan.name: Gigs Global

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the subscription.

get.description: Lists usage records in ascending order for a subscription, defaulting to `daily` aggregation for the latest subscription period.

parameters.name: period
parameters.description: Limits the usage data returned to the subscription period provided. This option is incompatible with the `start` and `end` parameters.

parameters.name: start
parameters.description: Limits the usage data to dates greater than or equal to the provided date. Can only be used in combination with `end`.

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: Limits the usage data to dates up to and including the provided date. Can only be used in combination with `start`.

parameters.name: aggregation
parameters.description: Determines the aggregation method used, defaulting to `daily`. `period` provides a single aggregated value for the time range or period requested.

200.description: Returns the list of usage records.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

get.description: Returns a list of addresses owned by the given user. The addresses returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created addresses appearing first.

200.description: Returns a list of address objects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

post.description: Create a new address for the given user with the given parameters.

line1.description: The first line of the given street address, e.g. street and house number.

line2.description: The second line of the given street address, e.g. Apartment number.

city.description: The city/municipality of the given street address.

state.description: The state/province/region of the given street address. Required for US/CA addresses to be a valid ISO 3166-2 2 letter code.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the given street address. Required for countries with postal codes.

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the given address.

422.description: The address creation request can't be processed, due to an invalid parameter or incompatible system state.

Invalid address response with no correct.summary: Invalid address response with no correction suggestions

value.message: The given address is not valid.

Invalid address response with suggestion.summary: Invalid address response with suggestions and a missing field

details.message: The value for this property is incomplete or missing.

value.message: The given address is not valid.

parameters.name: user
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the address.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing address for a given user.

200.description: Returns the address if it exists and is owned by the user.

delete.description: Retrieves the details of an existing user address and deletes it.

200.description: Returns the address after a successful deletion.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the user.

get.description: Retrieves the details of an existing user. You need only supply the unique user identifier that was returned upon user creation.

200.description: Returns the user object if the user exists.

delete.description: Retrieves the details of an existing user and deletes it.

200.description: Returns the user after a successful deletion.

patch.description: Updates the specified user by setting the values of the parameters passed.

email.description: The primary verified email address of the user.

fullName.description: The user's full name. Required for some Plans.

preferredLocale.description: The user's locale preference represented as an [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag).

200.description: Returns the updated user.

post.description: Searches for existing users matching the given parameters.

email.description: The primary email address of the user.

200.description: Returns the users matching the search criteria.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

get.description: Returns a list of users. The users returned are sorted by creation date, with the most recently created users appearing first.

200.description: Returns a dictionary with an items property that contains an array of user objects.

moreItemsAfter.description: A unique identifier to be used as `after` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted after the current batch of items.

moreItemsBefore.description: A unique identifier to be used as `before` pagination parameter if more items are available sorted before the current batch of items.

post.description: Creates a new user with the given parameters.

email.description: The primary verified email address of the user.

fullName.description: The user's full name. Some plans require the user name to be present when creating a subscription. Check the plan requirements for that.

preferredLocale.description: The user's locale preference represented as an [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag). It defaults to the project's preferred locale.

id.description: Unique identifier for the coverage configuration.

countries.description: List of countries in ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format covered by this coverage configuration.

name.description: A human-readable identifier of the coverage configuration, might not be unique.

imei.description: The IMEI (international mobile equipment identity) of the device if provided.

brand.description: The brand of the device model.

simTypes.description: List of SIM types supported by this device model.

type.description: The type of the device model.

name.description: An optional custom name for the device.

sims.description: List of SIMs added to this device.

email.description: The primary email address of the user.

emailVerified.description: Whether the user's primary email address is verified or not.

fullName.description: The user's full name. Required for some Plans.

preferredLocale.description: The user's locale preference represented as an [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag).

createdAt.description: Time when the user was created.
Time when the device was created.

brand.description: The brand of the device model.

simTypes.description: List of SIM types supported by this device model.

type.description: The type of the device model.

code.description: A machine-readable description of the error.

details.description:
Optional array containing specific information for the current error.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This property is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

documentation.description: An optional list of URLs providing further information to resolve the error.

hint.description: An optional explanation how to resolve the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

createdAt.description: Time when the organization was created.

data.description: The data allowance included in this plan. A value of `-1` indicates unlimited data.

dataUnit.description: The unit of the data value is always `byte`.

description.description: The plan's description, meant to be displayable to the users.
examples: A data plan you will love! Operates in most countries of the world.

image.description: The plan's image, meant to be displayable to the users.

name.description: The plan's name, meant to be displayable to the users.

amount.description: The price amount in the currency's minor unit, e.g. "cents" for many currencies.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code. Must be a supported currency.

provider.description: The ID of the network provider supported by this plan.

address.description: The address requirements that must be fulfilled before a user may purchase a subscription.

device.description: The device requirements that must be fulfilled before a user may purchase a subscription.

user.birthday.description: The user birthday requirements that must be fulfilled before a user may purchase a subscription.

user.fullName.description: The user full name requirements that must be fulfilled before a user may purchase a subscription.

simTypes.description: List of SIM types supported by this plan. Can be `eSIM`, `pSIM`, or both.

sms.description: The SMS allowance included in this plan. A value of `-1` indicates unlimited SMS.

smsUnit.description: The unit of the sms value is always `message`.

tags.description: List of tags describing this plan.

minimumPeriods.description: The minimum number of subscription periods that the plan must be renewed.

type.description: The validity type of this plan, either `oneTime` or `recurring`.

unit.description: The time unit of the subscription period, either `day` or `month`.

value.description: The amount of units (specified in the `unit` property) in each subscription period.

voice.description: The voice call allowance in seconds included in this plan. A value of `-1` indicates unlimited voice calls.

voiceUnit.description: The unit of the voice value is always `second`.

createdAt.description: Time when the plan was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the given document.

plan.description: Unique identifier for the plan associated to this document.

type.description: The MIME type for the given document.

url.description: The URL at which the document can be retrieved.

createdAt.description: The time the document was created.

accountNumber.description: The account number on the donor service provider.

birthday.description: The birthday of the account holder on the donor service provider.

declinedAttempts.description: The number of declined porting attempts so far.

donorProvider.description: The service provider from whom the number is ported.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service provider.

name.description: The name of the service provider, usually a brand name.

recipientProviders.description: List of network providers IDs that can receive portings from the service provider.

firstName.description: The first name of the account holder on the donor service provider.

lastName.description: The last name of the account holder on the donor service provider.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number to port in E.164 format.

provider.description: The ID of the recipient network provider.

recipientProvider.description: The service provider to whom the number is ported.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service provider.

name.description: The name of the service provider, usually a brand name.

recipientProviders.description: List of network providers IDs that can receive portings from the service provider.

required.description: List of fields required for the porting to be processable. The fields depend on the donor and recipient providers.

status.description: The current status of the porting.

subscription.description: Unique identifier for the porting subscription.

user.description: Unique identifier for the user this porting is for.

canceledAt.description: Time when the porting was canceled.

completedAt.description: Time when the porting was completed.

createdAt.description: Time when the porting was created.

lastDeclinedAt.description: Time when the porting was last declined.

lastRequestedAt.description: Time when the porting was last requested.

id.description: Globally unique identifier for the project.

domain.description: The canonical domain to access the project if available.

image.description:
Small-resolution project icon with an aspect ratio of `1:1`.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This property is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

images.description: Deprecated object of project images. Please use the image property instead.

favicon.description: Small-resolution project favicon with an aspect ratio of `1:1`.

icon.description: Small-resolution project icon with an aspect ratio of `1:1`.

logoHorizontal.description: High-resolution project logo with an aspect ratio of `7:1`.

legal.description: The legal address for the company that manages the project.

city.description: The city/municipality of the company's legal address.

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the company's legal address.

line1.description: The first line of the company's legal address, e.g. street and house number.

line2.description: The second line of the given street address, e.g. Apartment number.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the given street address.

state.description: The state/province/region of the given street address.

locales.description: List of supported locales represented as [IETF language tags](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag), ordered by preference.

name.description: A human-readable name for the project.

payments.description: Configuration parameters for the project use of payments.

currency.description: Three-letter ISO 4217 currency code representing the currency of the project. Must be a supported currency.

mode.description: The mode in which the payments operate.

settings.description: Deprecated object of application and integration settings. Please use the new installations endpoints instead.

subscriptionOwner.description: Indicates which entity will be registered as the owner of the subscription with the providers. When `company` is selected the legal address associated with the project will be used for the registration.

support.description: Contact details for consumer support requests regarding the project.

email.description: A publicly available email address for consumer support requests regarding the project.

phoneNumber.description: A publicly available phone number in E.164 format for consumer support requests regarding the project.

createdAt.description: Time when the project was created.

code.description: A machine-readable description of the error.

message.description: A human readable description of the error.

property.description: Name of the property associated with the error.

suggestion.description: Suggested alternative value for the field.

id.description: Unique identifier for the service provider.

name.description: The name of the service provider, usually a brand name.

recipientProviders.description: List of network providers IDs that can receive portings from the service provider.

iccid.description: The ICCID (integrated circuit card identifier) associated with the SIM.

provider.description: The ID of the network provider of the SIM.

status.description: The status of the SIM. Can be `active` or `inactive`.

type.description: The type of the SIM. Can be `eSIM` or `pSIM`.

createdAt.description: Time when the SIM was created.

activationCode.description: eSIM activation code to download and install the profile in a device. Only available for type `eSIM`.

qrCodeUrl.description:
URL of the activation code in QR-Code format. Only available for type `eSIM`.

<!-- theme: warning -->

> Be careful how you share this URL, it can be accessed publicly without authentication.

sim.description: Unique identifier for the SIM this credentials are for.

number.description: Sequence number of the subscription period.

start.description: Beginning of the current subscription period.

end.description: End of the current subscription period.

phoneNumber.description: The phone number attached to the SIM in E.164 format. Only available for voice plans.

porting.description:
Unique identifier for the porting.

<!-- theme: info -->
> #### Preview
>
> This property is currently in preview and might change in the future.
> We’re excited to hear your feedback and ideas. Please send an email
> to [support@gigs.com](mailto:support@gigs.com) to share your thoughts.

iccid.description: The ICCID (integrated circuit card identifier) associated with the SIM.

provider.description: The ID of the network provider of the SIM.

status.description: The status of the SIM. Can be `active` or `inactive`.

type.description: The type of the SIM. Can be `eSIM` or `pSIM`.

createdAt.description: Time when the SIM was created.

status.description: The current status of the subscription.

activatedAt.description: Time when the subscription was activated.

canceledAt.description: Time when the subscription was canceled.

createdAt.description: Time when the subscription was created.

endedAt.description: Time when the subscription was ended.

firstUsageAt.description: Time when the subscription was first used.

start.description: Timestamp representing the inclusive lower bound of the aggregation period (e.g. the start of a 24 hour period, subscription period or user-defined set of dates)

end.description: Timestamp representing the exclusive upper bound of the aggregation period (e.g. the end of a 24 hour period, subscription period or user-defined set of dates).

data.description: Amount of data used in bytes.

voice.description: Amount of voice usage in seconds.

sms.description: Amount of SMS sent and received.

email.description: The primary email address of the user.

emailVerified.description: Whether the user's primary email address is verified or not.

fullName.description: The user's full name. Required for some Plans.

preferredLocale.description: The user's locale preference represented as an [IETF language tag](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag).

createdAt.description: Time when the user was created.

id.description: Unique identifier for the given address.

city.description: The city/municipality of the given street address.

country.description: The ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code for the given address.

line1.description: The first line of the given street address, e.g. street and house number.

line2.description: The second line of the given street address, e.g. Apartment number.

postalCode.description: The postal code of the given street address.

state.description: The state/province/region of the given street address.

user.description: Unique identifier for the given address user.

createdAt.description: The time the address was created.

badRequest.description: The request has incorrect syntax, such as an unparseable JSON body.

permissionDenied.description: The authenticated user doesn't have permissions to perform the request.

conflict.description: The request conflicts with another request.

unprocessableEntity.description: The request can't be processed, often due to an invalid parameter or incompatible system state.

notImplemented.description: The type of request is not supported.

listAfter.name: after
listAfter.description: A cursor for use in pagination. The `after` parameter takes an object ID that defines the position in the list, only items immediately following the item with that ID will be returned.

listBefore.name: before
listBefore.description: A cursor for use in pagination. The `before` parameter takes an object ID that defines the position in the list, only items immediately preceding the item with that ID will be returned.

listLimit.name: limit
listLimit.description: The limit of items to be returned in the list, between 0 and 200.
